Description: Fragment of lip and wall of Attic black-glazed pottery vessel. Wholly painted; lightly offset tall rim and curving wall.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

It is not easy to specify the shape of this piece, if the profile drawing in CVA is accurate. Heidelberg, Antikenmuseum I52-I77 and I85-I92 have in the past been erroneously known and cited as J52-77 and J85-92.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg IV / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Deutschland Heidelberg, Universität (p.53 pl. 166.21)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2022)
